channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Zealand to ban greyhound racing
item.description: The industry has long faced criticism, with some breeders accused of mistreating or doping the animals.

item.title: A phone company developed an AI 'granny' to beat scammers at their own game
item.description: The company behind the scam-baiting granny said the AI technology can keep scammers on the phone for 40 minutes at a time, keeping them away from real...

item.title: Luigi Mangione charged with murdering healthcare CEO in New York
item.description: The 26-year-old man was taken into custody at a McDonald's in the town of Altoona, Pennsylvania, on Monday.

item.title: Suspect charged in UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killing
item.description: Luigi Mangione, the suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, is now charged with murder in New York City.

item.title: Franklin Fire forces evacuations in Malibu as red flag warnings continue
item.description: The fire has already burned more than 850 acres of brush, firefighters said.

item.title: U.S. "fondness for tall SUVs and pickups" compounds risks to pedestrians
item.description: The IIHS says a "small increase in crash speed can really ramp up the danger to a pedestrian," and our penchant for big vehicles "has intensified that...

item.title: Person of interest in UnitedHealthcare CEO killing arraigned, denied bail
item.description: Luigi Mangione, a man arrested in Pennsylvania, is being questioned in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in New York C...

item.title: Israel carries out dozens of air strikes across Syria, reports say
item.description: Israel says it is acting to stop weapons falling "into the hands of extremists" following the end of Assad's regime.

item.title: Suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO killing charged with murder in New York, court records show
item.description: Court records show New York prosecutors have charged a man with murder in the fatal shooting of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO was likely killed with a ghost gun that can be made at home
The fall of Syria's Assad has renewed hope for the release of U.S. journalist Austin Tice
item.description: Austin Tice went missing during a reporting trip in Syria in 2012. His release is a top priority for the U.S. government following a rebel group's ous...

item.title: 'We're absolutely in panic mode': Toymakers are bracing for Trump's tariffs
item.description: Toy companies are preparing for tariffs in the new Trump administration. Nearly all toys sold in the U.S. are imported — mostly from China.

item.title: Syria rescuers end search for secret cells in notorious prison
item.description: The White Helmets say it did not find any "unopened or hidden areas" after it was captured by rebels.

item.title: Champion cyclist pleads guilty over wife's car death
item.description: Rohan Dennis was driving a car that struck his wife, fellow Olympian Melissa Hoskins, in Australia.

item.title: YouTube algorithms push eating disorder content to teen girls, study finds
item.description: Study released by the Center for Countering Digital Hate confirms YouTube algorithms consistently push eating disorder and self-harm content to teen g...

item.title: Florida prosecutor seeks to overturn convictions in cocaine sting operation
item.description: A Florida prosecutor says he will seek to vacate as many as 2,600 convictions of people who bought crack cocaine made by the Broward County Sheriff's ...
